Two thumbs up!

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Shannyn is a host who truly understands and upholds the concept of hospitality. The studio is beautifully maintained and actually larger than I expected, with three separate rooms. The bathroom is huge, and has two sinks...as a solo or couple, you will have plenty of space. I loved that there was a cart with shelves in bathroom where I could set out my toiletries, hair accessories, etc. The kitchenette covered all of my basic needs, and there were both caffeinated and decaf selections for the coffee maker. Ample clothes hangers in the closet, and plenty of towels in the bathroom. The shower was sparkling clean and stocked with nice soap, shampoo, and conditioner brands, including products for sensitive skin. I found the location ideal for getting to locations in both Coos Bay and North Bend, and the parking spot is very easy to get in and out of. The bed is slightly firm, but very comfortable with a couple of different types of pillows to choose from. One detail to bear in mind is that the studio has skylights, so if you are very sensitive to light in your sleeping area you might consider an eye cover if the sun wakes up before you do. I will absolutely try to book this accommodation the next time I am in the area.

name: Diana
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
September 2023
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: My husband and I stayed at Mindy and Cameron's Studio for 4 nights while we vacationed in Oregon. The studio is beautifully located in its own secluded space in their backyard, surrounded by trees, shrubbery, and a tall wood fence. The house is well-designed and organized, with a large living/sleeping area and nicely-designed kitchen space. The bathroom is small, but has a sturdy Kohler sink, and a beautifully-tiled shower. It was very clean and fresh inside with huge windows, comfortable bed, and swivel easy chair. The kitchen functioned very well for us, with a stainless steel sink, microwave in a cabinet under the counter, coffeemaker and coffee, and a tiny fridge/freezer. I had wondered if it would feel a little damp inside the house, being so close to the bay, but it was dry and cozy, even during a rain shower. We would definitely stay here again.

review_text:
The cottage seems new & was cute, very clean & cozy! The backyard was tranquil, lush & pretty. The bed was comfortable. However, the first night the neighbor guy on other side of fence stayed outside on deck until about 11 listening to loud music. We actually liked the songs, but it was very loud for that time of night & sleeping (even with all windows & doors shut). The second night it was extremely quiet & peaceful. There is an outdoor sitting area & even a fire pit.
We brought our own food & were able to cook. There is a microwave, coffee maker, hot water kettle, mini fridge, & hot plate w/ 1 pot & 1 pan.
We didnâ€™t spend a lot of time at cottage during day as we were busy exploring the area. We basically just had breakfast, headed out for the day & returned for hot showers, dinner & sleeping. We highly recommend visiting Shore Acres! There are gorgeous gardens there, hiking trails, beaches, coastal views etc. It was a really enjoyable place to savor all things nature

review_text: Fantastic studio!! Before even arriving we received such perfect and clear communication with all needed info and were welcomed by flexibility with our check in time. The studio was so clearly put together with the utmost care and thoughtfulness. It included the basics of everything you need with a few extras (shampoo, conditioner, body wash, coffee and a couple of snacks) it had a comfortable Queen bed, cozy bedding, it was quiet and also had a nice fan provided for additional white noise. It was extremely clean and as someone who is sensitive to artificial fragrance I so appreciated that it was minimal and the bedding did not smell of fabric softener. The side entrance and back yard seclusion make it feel private and cozy. Great location, beautiful and relaxing space and excellent host descriptions, communication and nicely curated space. We will be back!

review_text: Iâ€™ve never considered booking an Airbnb in Coos Bay as we normally visit to go riding and camp, however if youâ€™re looking to get the dune experience and still have the comfort of a house, this place is perfectly located just across the bridge from Horsefalls and Boxcar. We came over this time for a quick crabbing trip and we ended up booking this location due to the limited options available in Bandon, but the drive was well worth the comfort and cleanliness we experienced during our stay. I wanted to take a moment to appreciate the level of flexibility from Mindy and Cameron - after explaining our plans for arrival time (long before normal check-in for this location), they worked to get the location cleaned and ready for us much sooner. Obviously this is something that was not required of them, but we were very greatfull that they were willing to work with us. We would definitely recommend this Airbnb to others and would stay here again ourselves. Thanks again Mindy and Cameron!

There was a powerful floor fan to move air and cool the space however it was fairly loud. Bathroom was brand new, small pedestal sink with no counter space. Backyard where the bungalow is located is very quiet and private, instructions to go along the pathway were very clear. Overall Iâ€™d recommend staying here for a quick one-night stopover.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Cameron & Mindyâ€™s unit was a lovely place to visit and looks as described in their listing. Check-in was easy, you just walk through the gate on the side of the ownerâ€™s house and down into their pretty back yard where the studio is located. From there you just type in the lockbox password and youâ€™re all set. :-)
The unit was really clean, and well stocked, and was in a quiet neighborhood away from any road noise. The shower had plenty of hot water and there were thoughtful touches to make a guestâ€™s stay comfortable. Itâ€™s also in a good location for many restaurants and things to do in North Bend.
A fan and a space heater are provided for climate control. The fan works really well and is a bit noisy, so we opted to crack open the windows at night while we slept to keep things cool. The only downside (and totally not the ownerâ€™s fault) was that the local wild birds can be very loud in the morning and start very early.
All in all, we had a good experience and are thankful to Cameron & Mindy for a pleasant stay! :-)

review_text: I was pleasantly surprised at how clean and well maintained the property was, plenty of dishes, cooking utensils, comfortable beds, plenty of fresh, soft towels, we did not have to buy anything for our stay except food we wanted to prepare. I've stayed in many rentals but Lisa's place is the only place where we did not have to go buy tissue paper, laundry detergent, garbage bags.. etc. Everything was stocked nicely. I love that we were able to check in whenever we wanted since it was already empty and such a HUGE PLUS that we didnt have to be out by 10am and there was NO checkout list. I felt a bit odd leaving without stripping beds, washing dishes, towels and emptying garbage. This was a very relaxing stay. Lisa was amazing, responsive and a very warm host. We enjoyed the snack basket while kicking back and watching movies. Thank you Lisa for a great stay! Ill be back for a long term stay next year!

Stayed one night
review_text:
I appreciated that Lisa was willing to try to accommodate my disability by using less chemicals and airing the house out before our arrival.
Beds and pillows were very comfortable, like a good hotel. I liked the skylight too.
Carpet felt lush, couches are obviously new and very cozy. No lack of large flat screen TV'S!
Kitchen had everything we needed, plus a pleasant surprise of a little basket of treats.
An added bonus to do a load of laundry. I don't remember if Lisa provides detergent, we brought our own.
The house was just as expected from the pictures provided. The focus is not on it being an outdoor retreat, but Lisa has not pretended that it is, and it suited our needs well for a 1 night stay on a road trip. It is conveniently located, clean, roomy, and comfortable We appreciated finding a place that did not have a 2 night minimum.

review_text:
The indoor space was IMPECCABLY CLEAN!!! We've traveled worldwide & an Airbnb Super Host for several years. This is probably the cleanest rental we've stayed in. Colorful & well appointed, with everything necessary to make a comfortable stay, including linens, soaps & kitchen essentials. And VERY spacious. Two TV sitting rooms, two dining tables, a large master suite at one end of the house plus 3 bedrooms/2 baths off the front hallway (1 ensuite & 2 single rms w/hall bath). The galley kitchen is smallish, but definitely adequate & fully stocked for on site cooking. Easy to find & handy location with a car. We explored the different waterfronts, but really came to visit the Shore Acres State Park which was about a 20 minute drive away. Our hosts were accessible & responded quickly.
Many thanks to our hosts, Teri & Crew, for a great experience!

In addition, the room comes equipped with a nice 40" tv with a plethora of options from Netflix to Disney+ to pick from. Bathroom is shared with other 2 other Airbnb guests/rooms (depending on if the place is full) but everyone was friendly, and this did not pose any issues for me. Kelsea made herself available to ensure a smooth check-in, and was warm and friendly. I would def. recommend a stay here during your time in Coos Bay.

review_text:
The Mingus Park cottage is in a great location if you want a wonderful nearby park with nature trails and to be 5 or 10 minutes from downtown. Vicki responds very quickly to communications and goes the extra mile doing all she can to make your stay exceptional.
Do feel free to communicate with her about any and all needs you may have both prior to and during your stay. She absolutely wants every opportunity to resolve any issues that may arise during your stay as quickly as possible. Simply superb hospitality. Vicki also has plans to uplevel/upgrade the place over the years. I hope to return someday to enjoy the rainy season in Coos Bay and an upgraded Mingus Park Cottage! Thanks for all your love and support Vicki!

Bedrooms were a little chilly at night (stayed late November), but the owner warned us of it, and the warm cozy blankets on the comfy beds made up for it. Would stay again!

name: Miles
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
October 2020
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We enjoyed a peaceful week at Mingus Park Cottage. Vicki was a great host - she made us feel very welcome and comfortable, and was very quick to respond to any communications. The cottage is very clean and cozy.
Vicki provided lots of extra little touches that were very thoughtful- she had turned on several small lamps and the porch light since we were planning to arrive after dark. There was coffee and creamer when we arrived along with a few bottles of water, the kitchen also had a good variety of spices, and oil for cooking, which saved us a trip to the grocery store. There were a few travel-size toiletries available if we had forgotten our own and plenty of extra linens and blankets if we needed them.
The back porch would be a great place to hang out and relax - though it was a bit chilly to sit long in late October.
We will definitely look to stay here again on any future trips to the Coos Bay area!

name: Karen
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
October 2020
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The cottage is perfect for a long weekend getaway (or even an extended stay). My friend and I were impressed with the cleanliness, amenities, and abundance of kitchen and bath supplies and linens. The appliances are newer and well cared for (including a washer and dryer). There's even a nice coffee and tea station for guests. There was more than enough room for the two of us, and Vicki has done an excellent job of making the cottage feel cozy, welcoming, and like a home away from home. She was very responsive to my messages and easy to communicate with.
The cottage is located less than half a mile from downtown Coos Bay, so we walked to the Visitors Center and Boardwalk. Mingus Park is right down the street from the cottage, and it has a very nice Japanese garden style large pond/small lake with ducks, a walking path, and trails into more wooded areas of the park.
Check in and check out was super easy, and there is off-street parking in the back of the house. If only the weather had been a bit warmer, we would have taken our meals on the very pleasant back patio, which is complete with a a table and seating for four, a small fountain and lights. The neighborhood is entirely residential and very quiet.
I would recommend Mingus Park Cottage in a heartbeat for anyone who wants a delightful home base to explore Coos Bay and the southern Oregon Coast.

review_text: I booked this lovely house for my family as we were in Coos Bay for my beloved Aunt's memorial service. I needed a comfortable place for my parents, who are in their 80's, and they could not have been happier there. The beds are very comfortable, and my mother loved the heater/fireplace in the living room. She would sit and watch the birds fly in and out of the birdhouse in the front yard, quite warm and comfortable. The kitchen is large and well stocked, and the back patio is just lovely to sit and relax. It is just across from Mingus Park which is a very nice park to take a stroll. My daughter and I walked into town from the house as well, so it's very convenient for that as well. Great stay all the way around, and Vicki was quick to respond to any need we had. Highly recommend this place.

The King size bed and linens were extremely comfortable. It's got a huge walkin closet, but my favorite was the huge bathroom with a Jacuzzi tub. The jets were not working, but it was so wonderful to soak in that tub. There's all kinds of luxurious things to add to the pampering...bath salts, great soaps , shampoos, conditioner, lotion, large fluffy towels, and in the bedroom a heater and many soft blankets to choose from.
It's conveniently close to town. We never heard noise from the host side of the house, so felt very private. Did not meet Miyeong, but she was so kind and quick with communication. Thank you, Miyeong!

review_text: What a nice place to stay at an affordable price. The bed was so big and comfortable and the room was sooo clean! We enjoyed the nice and quiet neighborhood . The home sits on top of a hill, so we had a nice view of the town, the bay, the bridge and the hosts' nice backyard. The first morning we enjoyed some complimentary coffee from the Keurig while sitting in front of the open door. What a nice, peaceful way to start the day. Once we got up to get ready and explore, we had no problem sharing the large bathroom together. We came to North Bend/Coos Bay mainly to dine at Restaurant O, but our stay here was the cherry on top. We hope we can stay here again next time we are in the area. Thank you Miyeong!

review_text:
I am happy to find a place I can stay when I travel to the area for work - Iâ€™m not a big fan of the roadside motels or larger motels in the area.
This is part of their home with a separate entrance in the back of the home. It consists of a bedroom with a king bed with super comfy bedding, an entryway area that has a mini fridge with bottled water and coffee creamer, a Kuerig and a microwave. Some paper plates, cups, napkins and plastic utensils, coffee pods, sugars included, as well. There is a walk in closet and a large bathroom with a large jetted tub, a separate dual head shower and double sinks.
I didnâ€™t hear the owners in their home at all (though I believe they were home).
Additions that would be helpful would be a full sized mirror in the closet, and an iron and ironing board for business travelers (like me).

name: Lindsey
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
August 2022
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: We had a very lovely stay in this house. It was a bit smaller than we had expected, but I think it was because the mirrors in the house make it look much bigger. It was plenty big for our family of 5 though. The house was very clean and all of the necessities were provided. The kitchen was well stocked and we cooked just about every day here. It was so lovely to have a cup of coffee and watch the boats going in and out of the bay. It was super cool to watch the fishing/crabbing boats each morning when the tide was low. There isn't a whole lot to do in North Bend, but the beaches and sand dunes are a short drive from the house. There are a couple of parks close by (one is right in the neighborhood) that we took the kids to and they had so much fun. If I had to pick one thing to complain about in the house it would be the uncomfortable pillows. And this is just a personal preference so it's really not a big deal. But if you are picky about your pillows, just bring your own is my suggestion. :) I would definitely book a stay again here in the future.

review_text: Choke and Jasonâ€™s home was perfect for our family getaway. Had just the right amount of space for my husband and I, my in laws and our son. The neighborhood is very quiet and thereâ€™s a park close by you can walk to. The view of the bay was super peaceful and relaxing with a morning cup of coffee. The living room seating has just one love seat, so we found ourselves taking turns between the couch and the dining chairs/bar stools. There are two mini refrigerators in the main home and a full side refrigerator with freezer in the garage. Unique setup but worked for us. Chloe and Jason are very quick to respond to any questions or concerns. When we arrived the propane was out in the bbq. I let them know and that same day (within hours) they dropped off and hooked up a new tank. Great experience. Would book again.

review_text:
Place was lovely. Well set up and felt like home.
Great heating systems which were needed due to the cold snap.
Hosts, Kelsea & Kate, were very friendly & very reactive to any queries.
Some of the best hosts we have ever encountered in many years using Airbnb & other casual rental properties.
We had a minor problem with the electronic entry pad but on phoning Kelsea, she and Kate came almost immediately to investigate & correct the electronic problem which wasn't of their doing.
We mentioned there appeared to be a shortage of a teaspoon and a knife, which we said wasn't a problem to us but maybe could be corrected for future guests.
Despite that comment, they very quickly delivered a complete new cutlery set, to ensure we were fully satisfied.
The off-street parking and use of washer and dryer were very nice touches as was the availability of basic kitchen utensils & ingredients.
We would definitely use this home again if we were in the area.

This was the perfect place for me and my dog to stay while spending 4 days in the Coos Bay area. I love the location of this apartment. The neighborhood is quiet and a pleasant area for dog walking. It's near Mingus Park and just a short drive to some great restaurants in downtown Coos Bay and along the waterfront.
The apartment was clean and comfortable and has plenty of space. I appreciated the big window that looks into the backyard where I could see the flowering dogwood in bloom. Having access to the large fenced yard was wonderful because it made traveling with my little dog so much easier. The yard has lots of mature landscaping which makes it an interesting and very private space. My dog liked exploring the yard while I hung out. And we both enjoyed meeting Kate and her dog Pippin!
We'll be back. ğŸ™‚
Kathy and Archie

review_text: We were in Coos Bay to watch our niece play in the state basketball play-offs. Kateâ€™s place was perfect for our needs. The central location was great since we had games at both North Bend and Coos Bay high schools and it is close to eateries and grocery stores. Furniture and bedding was very clean and comfortable. The kitchen is well-equipped and we enjoyed the picture window view of the backyard. It is full of wonderful mature trees and shrubs that will be even more beautiful in bloom! It was completely fenced and perfect for our large puppyâ€™s outdoor time. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again!
